title: Treasury yields move higher as investors monitor earnings, auctions
text:
U.S. government debt prices were slightly lower Monday morning.

At around 5:00 a.m. ET, the yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note, which moves inversely to the price, was higher at around 1.8278%, while the yield on the 30-year Treasury bond was also higher at around 2.3185%.

Traders are likely to monitor stock markets in what is set to be the busiest week for corporate earnings. Elsewhere, the U.S. trade representative said Friday that Beijing and Washington have "made headway on specific issues and the two sides are close to finalizing some sections of the agreement." The world's two largest economies have recently pushed for a trade agreement after a tariff conflict that has soured business sentiment and global markets.

On the data front, advanced economic indicators are due at 08:30 a.m. and Dallas Fed manufacturing figures due at 10:30 a.m. ET.

The U.S. Treasury is set to auction $87 billion in 13-week and 26-week bills on Monday.
description: U.S. government debt prices were slightly lower Monday morning.
